articles.title: At $250 million, top AI salaries dwarf those of the Manhattan Project and the Space Race
articles.summary: Meta has set a new benchmark in tech compensation by offering AI researcher Matt Deitke a staggering $250 million over four years, eclipsing historical salaries in science and technology. This milestone underscores the intense competition among tech giants like Meta, Google, and OpenAI to develop artificial general intelligence (AGI), with the potential for market dominance worth trillions at stake. As companies continue to invest heavily in AI talent, this trend may reshape the landscape of tech recruitment and compensation, drawing parallels to the sports industry.
